alert.note: Alert for Blount (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 25 at 1:10AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Blount County through 145 AM CDT... At 110 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Arab to near Holly Pond. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Snead, McLarty, Brooksville and Strawberry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
